intro: Blepharis noli-me-tangere, commonly known as the "Don't touch me" grass, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance with small, tubular flowers. The plant produces bright yellow or orange blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its common name originates from the Latin phrase, meaning "do not touch me," likely due to its tendency to be sensitive to touch. Blepharis noli-me-tangere thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
